data.scheme_name: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy 2023-28 - Powerloom Sector (Cooperative Powerloom ) - Capital Subsidy - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides government incentives ranging from 30% to 45% to the cooperative powerloom sector.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in Powerloom sector.
data.conditions:
Although Textile Units/Projects can establish solar plants of more than 4MW capacity, the entire financial burden for establishing capacity over 4MW shall be borne by the unit/project itself.
If the total capacity of solar power plant being established shall not exceed the approved load / contract demand of conventional energy.
After the installation of solar power plant units, it shall be the responsibility of the textile units to maintain its operationality. If not, no subsidy will be provided.
The cooperative units availing share capital from the State Government shall not be eligible for capital subsidy.
The units will be considered for technology upgradation under the MAHA Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (MAHA-TUFS), provided: 
The unit have completed 15 years of production on the existing machinery. 
The unit has a net positive worth. 
The unit uses clean energy.  
The unit has paid-back/ returned at least 50% of the Government share capital.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in Powerloom sector.

data.context: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy of the State is in line with the 5F vision of the Government of India- Farm to Fiber to Factory to Fashion to Foreign. The policy envisions integrating the whole textile value chain and create an enabling environment for sustained growth of all sub-sectors in the industry.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the sector and encourage units in various parts of the State.
data.description:
Scheme provides government incentives based on following zones:
Zone 1 : 45% government equity and 50% loan from FI
Zone 2 : 40% government equity and 50% loan from FI
Zone 3 : 35% government equity and 50% loan from FI
Zone 4 : 30% government equity and 50% loan from FI

Capital Investment Subsidy under MAHA-TUFS :
Zone 1 : 40% of cost of eligible machinery  or Rs. 2500 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 2 : 35% of cost of eligible machinery  or Rs. 2000 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 3 : 30% of cost of eligible machinery  or Rs. 1500 lakhs, whichever is less
Zone 4 : 25%  of cost of eligible machinery  or Rs. 1000 lakhs, whichever is less
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the Maharashtra Textile Department : https://etextile.maharashtra.gov.in/registration
data.funding_mechanism:
The capital subsidy will be paid after the project comes into production. This will be paid in two installments:
i. 1st instalment: 60% of eligible amount after 12 months.
ii. 2nd instalment: 40% of eligible amount after 24 months.
data.additional_info:
Zone 1: - Amravati, Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Nagpur, Washim, Wardha, Yavatmal.
Zone 2: - Aurangabad, Beed, Dhule, Hingoli, Jalgaon, Jalna, Latur, Nanded, Osmanabad, Parbhani.
Zone 3: - Ahmednagar, Nashik, Nandurbar.
Zone 4: - Kolhapur, Mumbai City, Mumbai Suburban, Palaghar, Pune, Ratnagiri, Raigad, Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara, Solapur, Thane.
